docs.title: Royal Thai

thumbnail.alt: Screenshot of the Royal Thai homepage
thumbnail.name: Royal Thai Homepage

docs.excerpt: A luxurious website for an established carpet design company.

featuredImage.alt: Screenshot of the Royal Thai homepage
featuredImage.name: Royal Thai Homepage

children.text: Royal Thai is a premier carpet manufacture and design company with a history dating back to 1967. Their goal was to create a modern design that communicated their sophistication, creativity, and legacy to a wide variety of clients around the world.

I picked up this project in the beginning stages when it was falling behind schedule. I started work on organizing the content from the client and working together with our designer to build out page layouts based on the content we had while the client gathered everything else from corporate.

image.alt: Screenshot of the Hand Tufted page from Royal Thai's website

children.text: The site had a large amount of information and images and our main goal was to organize all of this content in a way that felt cohesive and more importantly was useful for Royal Thai's clients.

image.alt: Screenshot of Royal Thai's project page

children.text: We found that in addition to the header navigation, we left threads going to different related parts of the website nested within individual pages. On the Expertise page we showed a list of related projects for each expertise so that users interested in a certain area could continue to browse. While working on the website we found the carpets to be very visually interesting and that this imagery was a great way to lead users through the website, increasing their interest in Royal Thai along the way.

image.alt: Screenshot of the Royal Thai hotels page

children.text: In the end with help from the provided amazing imagery from the carpets, we were able to create an immersive digital showroom for customers to browse different carpet categories and learn about the story, mission, and capabilities of Royal Thai.

docs.title: Don't Get Swatted
docs.excerpt: A branching story game built in 10 days for the 2024 One Button Jam

children.text: Don't Get Swatted is a one button game that lets users navigate through a choose-your-adventure style story with collectable unique endings and art. I worked on the development of the game, setting our team with tools to collaborate, and worked to glue everything together.

I worked as a developer alongside an artist, writer and another developer. With our main challenge being time, I focused solely ensuring sure the game was fully playable by the deadline. After coming up with the idea of a multiple choice, mad libs style story game, each group split off to work on their part. I focused on understanding the visions of both the artist and writer and translated them into issues we could tackle on the software side.

image.alt: Screenshot of Don't Get Swatted's Twine Storyboard

children.text: As development of the base game was underway I looked into future development challenges. I found a Storyboarding software called Twine that our write could use to map out the branching story paths and would I could plug into our base game as a JSON.

image.alt: Bad ending 2 from Don't Get Swatted the game

children.text: Listening to the artist's vision I worked on adding their visuals to the game, writing code to plug in the different image variants based on the endings.

In between I setup a Github action to deploy our game to itch.io whenever we pushed to the main branch, saving us time on deployment. This also came in clutch when itch.io went down shortly before the deadline as we already had most of our changes pushed and could easily retry the deployment.

image.alt: Don't Get Swatted Found Endings Page

children.text: Towards the end I moved to other issues such as tweaking the frontend, adding an ending tracker for progress, making a last minute music addition, and other final changes and polishes.

image.alt: Picture from the camp end of Don't Get Swatted

children.text: The game was was released in time and received positive feedback from the jam host and other jammers. It ended up being a great learning experience in how to execute on a tight deadline and coordinate with others for an awesome outcome that players got to enjoy.

image.alt: Screenshot of the alternate paty background from Don't Get Swatted

docs.title: Inquizity

thumbnail.alt: Picture of computer with a quiz application
thumbnail.name: Inquizity Thumbnail

docs.excerpt: An AI quiz generator to save students and teachers time

featuredImage.alt: Picture of computer with a quiz application
featuredImage.name: Inquizity Thumbnail

children.text: Thought up to solve a personal need of mine; needing customized questions to fit the needs of students. I was able to accurately prompt LLMs for questions that fit the current needs of the students, so I created Inquizity to allow students to continue to generate questions on their own.

docs.title: Block Broker
docs.excerpt: A freelance contracting platform built in 48 hours for the MLH Web3 Hackathon.

children.text: Our team set out to create a smart contract based app to democratize freelancing on the web. I worked as the sole frontend developer while also bringing together the team from across the globe.

docs.title: Next Adventure
docs.excerpt: An immersive website for a full-service safari adventure company.

children.text: Next Adventure is a safari service that provides custom crafted journeys for clients. They were looking for a website that transported users to Africa with stunning visuals. We crafted a unique experience for 3 different kinds of clients, sending them to different areas of the website depending on how soon they were planning to journey to Africa.

docs.title: Real Lion
docs.excerpt: A modern design for a budding technology consultancy.

children.text: Real Lion is a tech sales coaching agency providing valueable insights into career growth and sucess in technology sales. The goal was to provide a frontend website with a member portal for customers to access premium resources.
"Hayden, Caely and the rest of the team did a great job. They were very responsive, provided thoughtful suggestions, and overall were a professional and capable partner. Highly recommended!"
Andrew G.

docs.title: Travel Gurus
docs.excerpt: A captivating design inspiring clients to travel to new destinations

children.text: Travel Gurus Group is a premier travel agency focused on providing VIP level travel experiences. The goal of the website was to communicate the luxury and attention to detail of the experiences being offered while showing clients what experience waited for them through captivating imagery.

docs.title: BA-TTI
docs.excerpt: An intuitive refresh for a teacher training institute.

featuredImage.alt: Screenshot of Bay Area Teacher Training Institute's homepage

children.text: The Bay Area Teacher Training Institute is an impactful education institution offering credentials, and masters in teaching degrees. The goal was to create a professional, and easy to navigate website for both prospective students and student needing information in a variety of different stages and programs.

docs.title: Platinum Advisors

thumbnail.alt: Screenshot of Platinum Advisors website homepage opening fold
thumbnail.name: Platinum Advisors Thumbnail

docs.excerpt: A sleek redesign for a national advocacy firm.

featuredImage.alt: Screenshot of Platinum Advisors website homepage

children.text: Platinum Advisors is a premier advocacy firm with a reach across the United States. They advise companies on large scale projects, lobby governments on every level to pass legislature, develop media narratives that reach consumer. Our goal was to redesign the website to better reflect their national reach, show the expertise of their team, and create a premier design that appealed to their stakeholders and clients.

As the sole designer and developer from our studio, I led a website redesign for Platinum Advisors, a national advocacy firm looking to showcase their expanded reach. Working with two client representatives who represented key stakeholders, I managed the project from initial wireframes through custom development in Squarespace.

Despite challenges with an expanding scope and indirect stakeholder communication, I delivered a modern, premium design that effectively organized complex information and incorporated custom styling elements, including the Will Meyers Slideshow plugin and specialized portrait frames. The project concluded successfully with stakeholder approval, though it required careful budget management and rapid feedback coordination to meet deadlines.
